alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 28 at 4:57AM EST until December 28 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Berks, Lehigh and Northampton. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A widespread 1.5 to 3.0 inches of rain has fallen across the watch area. Several creeks, streams, and rivers remain in flood stage. Additional rises are possible across the watch area through the morning. Remain alert for additional warnings that may be issued. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
